title.narrative: Cambodge (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Cambodia: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Successes and lessons learned documented and shared; scale-up plan developed

target.value: Strengthening of programmatic planning and budgeting processes

comment.narrative: - Before developing the EPI management dashboard, CHAI observed data utilization and evidenced-based decision-making was a challenge. Time was being spent to extract data from HMIS requiring individual downloads of data for performance of each antigen, health system level and time period based on need, followed by manual analysis in separate Excels to calculate coverage rates - After training PHDs on the Dashboard, PHDs could analyse many antigens, across levels for various periods more effectively through a simpler monthly download process. The dashboard requires 5 -10 minutes monthly to download raw HMIS data & upload to the dashboard which calculates performance indicators automatically. It can store up to 5 years of data - Included in the dashboard is a financial management component with indicators to track expenditure against funding sources, incl. Gavi HSS funding. As part of CHAI's technical support to the NIP to re-programme HSS2 funding as part of the second no cost extension (NCE) we assessed slow absorption rates in our focal provinces and observed the perception by PHDs of HSS funding being inflexible to province needs I.e. funding allocated to specific activities cannot be adjusted to cover other program gaps & therefore left funds remaining unused. PHDs were in favour of incorporating a degree of flexibility to allow provincial re-allocations - PHDs in both provinces plan to scale up the dashboard to ODs to support planning. Each OD may review their respective facilities for supervision, monitoring and planing. CHAI will provide continued technical support to PHD for the training of ODs - CHAI is on track to develop a lessons learned document on development & implementation of the dashboard at provincial level with NIP & partners. This will be finalised & shared by end of Dec 2021 - CHAI plans to collaborate with partners operating in other provinces to scale up the Dashboard into routine data review & program planning, providing technical support

title.narrative: New tools and processes for informed decision-making on planning and budgeting introduced, well set-up and functioning

target.value: Strengthening of programmatic planning and budgeting processes

comment.narrative: - Developed the sub-national EPI Management Dashboard (1 provice example attached) and user guide to provide visibility into program performance data down to health facility level in 2 focal provinces. - Oriented the Provincial Health Department team, which included EPI, MCH and HIS M&E staff, on how to use the dashboard effectively for decision-making, supervision planning and the development of an AOP. - PHD team plans to train the Operational District (OD) team on use of the dashboard during November/December which CHAI will support. - Supporting EPI to incorporate analysis from the dashboard into routine data review, particularly data review conducted to inform supportive supervision visits to HFs, and follow up on data quality at the OD and health facility levels. - CHAI also supported the provincial EPIs to develop a baseline analysis (1 province example attaached) using the dashboard in order to measure progress of the program since adoption of improved decision-making practice.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement

1). SOP for primary vaccine cold store finalized with staff trained end 2020. 2). EVM assessment conducted with improvement developed in 2020. 3). One third (N=404) of all health centers countrywide have staff trained in SOPs for immunization supply chain management by end 2020.

target.value: Technical support to strengthen immunisation supply chain management

comment.narrative: 1). SOPs for primary vaccine cold store has been finalized and core staff wrorking in primary stores were trained. Next steps will be to train support staff such as drivers, supervisors, guards and others relevant staff in specific SOP related to their roles and responsibilites. 2). EVM assessment conducted and EVM Improvement Plan finalized and ready for translation. Next step is to dissiminate the EVMA and IP and monitor the implementation by ISCL Task Team. The activities listed in the EVMA-IP will be used for development of cMYP.

title.narrative: 80% of health facilities (total 110) fully implemented immunization supply chain management based based on SOPs.

target.value: Implement SOP for immunization supply chain in health facilities in 5 north-east provinces

comment.narrative: 85% of EPI staff in health facilities applied SOP guidelines based on the report of SOP supervision. New EPI staff are also receiving on the job training to improve their performance in order to increase quality of vaccine and cold chain management.

title.narrative: WHO
Discussions held, process completed to hire short term consultant

target.value: Technical support to develop guidelines/SOPs on data management capacity for sub-national as per recommendation from Gavi Audit

comment.narrative: As mentioned earlier milestones, several efforts were made to hire consultant but unable to find. WHO will continue to look for consultant in remaining months of the year. Gavi SCM is well aware of it.

title.narrative: Dissemination workshop for the report of international border and urban province's assessment conducted and action plan developed to implement the activities

target.value: Technical support to conduct dissemination workshop of the results of international border and urban province assessment and development of action plan to implement the activities

comment.narrative: Dissemination workshop not conducted as there is restriction of meeting/workshop because of COVID-19 pandemic

title.narrative: UNICEF
50% of all provinces (13 out of 25) trained their health center staff in in SOP for immunization supply chain management

target.value: 2. Technical support to train health center staff in SOPs for immunization supply chain management

comment.narrative: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic with large-scale community spared since April which saw provincial lockdowns, the Government has continued to restrict trainings and workshops. NIP with partners imitated discussions to start planning and conducting virtual and remote training modalities, to catch up on this activity.

title.narrative: Implementation of scale up conducted nationally with allocated budget using the new list of village, new session plan,agreed upon denominator at HC and data accuracy template. Documentations done and shared.

target.value: 3. Technical assistance in national scale up and monitoring of following activities which was piloted in 2018 under Gavi TCA funds 1. Immunization service delivery assessment 2. Development of session plan 3. Data accuracy 4. Denominator use at local leve

comment.narrative: The service delivery asesssment has been implemented in each facility to classify sevice delivery strategy for each village in each health center coverage area as either high risk or catch up, or fixed site immunization strategy (based on the guideline for service delivery assessment, using local denominator data and local knowledge about the village), then developed session plans. Each provinces compiled list of villages classified as high risk villages and catch up villages for submission to NIP for the implementation of high risk and catch up strategies using the Gavi HSS fund.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Financing/Sustainability
Desk review and preparation completed for hiring consultant consultant and development of application completed

target.value: Start desk review and preparation of developing Gavi HSS3 application to submit to Gavi secretariat

comment.narrative: Due to unexpected situation of protracted COVID-19 pandemic and enormous pressure of COVID-19 vaccination campaign, Gavi Alliance and NIP discussed and agreed to extend the HSS2 grant to 2021 and probably extending to 2022. Therefore, it was discussed that National Immunization Strategy will be prepared first (it is under preparation) and then HSS3 development will be starting. WHO will provide support for the development of HSS3 starting from late 2021.

target.value: Start desk review and preparation of developing Gavi HSS3 application to submit to Gavi secretariat

comment.narrative: Due to unexpected situation of protracted COVID-19 pandemic and enormous pressure of COVID-19 vaccination campaign, Gavi Alliance and NIP discussed and agreed to extend the HSS2 grant to 2021 and probably extending to 2022. Therefore, it was discussed that National Immunization Strategy will be prepared first (it is under preparation) and then HSS3 development will be starting. WHO will provide support for the development of HSS3 starting from late 2021.

title.narrative: Consultative meeting to be conducted and first draft HSS3 proposal is available

target.value: Technical support and work together with other parters to NIP to develop proposal for Gavi HSS3 grant

comment.narrative: NIS draft was already developed in August 2021, and currently waiting for NIP finalization. Then discussion for HSS3 proposal will be started.

title.narrative: Discussions to be held and process to be initiated for writing Gavi HSS 3 proposal

target.value: Technical support and work together with other parters to NIP to develop proposal for Gavi HSS3 grant

comment.narrative: Several discussions took place for the process to initiate writing HSS3 proposal. It is agreed that NIS has to prepare first and then at the end of 2021 development of HSS3 activities will be starting to enable to submit it by mid-2022.

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Data
New friendly template on budgeting developed

target.value: Assessment of the existing tools, processes and templates for budgeting processes between central and subnational level and mapping of budgetary flows (requests, allocations, disbursals, etc.) along with their expected and practiced timeframes Streamlined budgeting and costing templates are created for all levels of the RI system SOPs for development of timely budgets, prioritization of activities, and timely consumption of disbursed funds are developed and reviewed by sub-national stakeholders

comment.narrative: As agreed with and approved by the Gavi SCM, given limited visibility of sub-national financial data CHAI proposed changes to milestones under Objective B to focus on evidence-based decision-making and planning rather than budgeting processes. Please see email attachment documenting record of approval of changes to the milestones

target.value: "Assessment of the existing tools, processes and templates for budgeting processes between central and subnational level and mapping of budgetary flows (requests, allocations, disbursals, etc.) along with their expected and practiced timeframes Streamlined budgeting and costing templates are created for all levels of the RI system SOPs for development of timely budgets, prioritization of activities, and timely consumption of disbursed funds are developed and reviewed by sub-national stakeholders"

comment.narrative: As the ?budgeting? topic is sensitive to be discussed with NIP and partners, CHAI has been delayed in making progress under this sub-objective. CHAI had therefore suggested to remove the ?budgeting? for now and to focus on program support. This was discussed with Gavi SCM over the CHAI/Gavi Telecon on 21 April 2021. This adjustment will allow CHAI to work better with the government. Being one of the new players in immunization space, CHAI needs more time to build relationship and trusts with NIP and partners before venturing to budgeting space. CHAI plans to continue to strengthen evidence-based planning, before eventually working our way towards budgeting. Gavi accepted CHAI?s proposal to remove the term ?budgeting? for now but reminded the importance for CHAI to remain closely involved. To continue to move forward in addressing gaps in subnational budgeting CHAI plans to support planning and budgeting at subnational level through introduction of new tools. CHAI has established working relationship with 2 focal provinces, Takeo and Kampong Chhang, to introduce the immunization program management dashboard at Province level. CHAI aims to increase performance visibility and informed decision making at the sub-national level, with new processes for routinely using evidence to agree on priority interventions. This would lead to enhanced ability to plan for execution of Gavi HSS activities in the 2 focus provinces through strengthened management structures. Successes and lessons learned from 2 focal provinces will be shared with national level and other provinces, and plan for scale up will be developed.

title.narrative: Job Aid on how to use dashboard developed

target.value: Training is conducted on the adoption, use and troubleshooting of the dashboard tools

comment.narrative: CHAI has developed the immunization program management dashboard which was a critical tool for immunization program management. The dashboard was developed to strengthen data quality and utilization to inform efficient decision-making, strategic planning, and resource allocation. Through greater visibility of program performance, the NIP will be able to readily identify and address implementation bottlenecks and in turn, develop tailored, effective strategies to address them. To support NIP leadership, NIP M&E focal person, and immunization partners to use the dashboard, CHAI has developed a user-friendly job aid on how to use dashboard (attached as part of the report) CHAI held several meetings with M&E focal person and both NIP deputy managers to orient them on the dashboard and the job aid. The NIP deputy manager has used the dashboard to capture data for Maternal Child Health Day and for monthly data monitoring. Additionally, CHAI also discussed the dashboard function and future improvement with UNICEF for future collaboration. Dashboard and its job aid/ user guides is being used by NIP leadership.

title.narrative: Formal secretariat created and role and responsible are defined

target.value: Formal secretariat support mechanisms are created with well-defined roles and responsibilities.

comment.narrative: Since the beginning of the grant, CHAI has initiated coordination meetings with NIP and partners, to secure buy-in and reaffirm CHAI?s mandate under the LMC grant. CHAI has supported NIP and partners to have regular meetings with set agendas and properly recorded minutes and action items, especially to monitor potential backsliding of routine immunization coverage through the dashboard use. However, the pandemic response and COVID-19 vaccination planning and roll out have made NIP and partners extremely busy and had to de-prioritize routine immunization monitoring. This is also due to pressure from higher ups to provide daily report of pandemic response for the Prime Minister. However, CHAI continues to advocate for routine immunization monitoring and has agreed with NIP manager to resume monthly meeting with partners starting 11 June 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Conducted implementation in remaining provinces. HC sent documentations to central NIP

target.value: Technical assistance to plan and implement following activities in remaining 21 provinces as per NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS2 grants; 1. Conduct service delivery assessment (Review the current service delivery strategies focusing on revision of status of high risk communities); 2. Review and development of vaccination session plan; 3. Review denominator used for immunization programme at local level (HC) for improving data quality; 4. Review accuracy of routine immunization coverage data including vaccine utilization; 5. other activities like developing monitoring chart, HC catchment area map, workplan etc.

comment.narrative: As reported earlier, this activity didn't able to implement because of COVID-19 pandemic. There was funding involvement with WHO but allocated fund in NIP's workplan from Gavi HSS grant. However, NIP shifted allocated fund to other areas especially to procurement by NIP.

target.value: Technical assistance to plan and implement following activities in remaining 21 provinces as per NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS2 grants; 1. Conduct service delivery assessment (Review the current service delivery strategies focusing on revision of status of high risk communities); 2. Review and development of vaccination session plan; 3. Review denominator used for immunization programme at local level (HC) for improving data quality; 4. Review accuracy of routine immunization coverage data including vaccine utilization; 5. other activities like developing monitoring chart, HC catchment area map, workplan etc.

comment.narrative: As reported earlier, this activity didn't able to implement because of COVID-19 pandemic. There was funding involvement with WHO but allocated fund in NIP's workplan from Gavi HSS grant. However, NIP shifted allocated fund to other areas especially to procurement by NIP.

title.narrative: Annual routine immunization and VPD surveillance data analyzed and annual bulletin prepared and distributed

target.value: Technical support and conduct supervision/monitoring of VPDs surveillance activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs/Hospitals. Support for routine immunization and VPD surveillance data management and analysis by national/ provinces/ODs/HCs

comment.narrative: Regularly conducted routine immunization and VPD surveillance data analysis, action points developed and shared to NIP and other stakeholders. Support made to NIP for measles and AFP surveillance data cleaning, entry and other management. Monthly bulletin prepared on VPD surveillance and monthly/quarterly routine immunization data analyzed PPT prepared and shared to NIP and other stakeholders.

target.value: Technical support and conduct supervision/monitoring of VPDs surveillance activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs/Hospitals. Support for routine immunization and VPD surveillance data management and analysis by national/ provinces/ODs/HCs

comment.narrative: Regularly conducted routine immunization and VPD surveillance data analysis, action points developed and shared to NIP and other stakeholders. Support made to NIP for measles and AFP surveillance data cleaning, entry and other management. Monthly bulletin prepared on VPD surveillance and monthly/quarterly routine immunization data analyzed PPT prepared and shared to NIP and other stakeholders.

title.narrative: Activities of action plan are integrated in NIP' AOP

target.value: Technical support to conduct dissemination workshop of the results of international border and urban province assessment and development of action plan to implement the activities

comment.narrative: Some activities were included but unable to implement because of COVID-19 pandemic. Discussion held and plan made to discuss action points with sub-national level staff but did not take place yet because of restriction.

title.narrative: Planned, prepared and participated in monitoring of one/two rounds of high risk communities/catch-up vaccination outreach services and conducted monitoring activities of routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs

target.value: Technical assistance to plan, prepare, implementation and monitoring of high risk communities and catch-up vaccination outreach services and conduct supervision/monitoring of routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs.

comment.narrative: Supported to plan, preparing, implementation and monitoring of four rounds of high-risk communities and catch-up vaccination outreach services. It was better planned and performances were best despite COVID-19 pandemic. More number of children were vaccinated in these four rounds and vaccination coverage increased and sustained. Whiled compared with 2019, 2020 performances were better. WHO staff and consultants visited provinces and monitored vaccination services for all four rounds.

target.value: Technical assistance to plan, prepare, implementation and monitoring of high risk communities and catch-up vaccination outreach services and conduct supervision/monitoring of routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs.

comment.narrative: Supported to plan, preparing, implementation and monitoring of four rounds of high-risk communities and catch-up vaccination outreach services. It was better planned and performances were best despite COVID-19 pandemic. More number of children were vaccinated in these four rounds and vaccination coverage increased and sustained. Whiled compared with 2019, 2020 performances were better. WHO staff and consultants visited provinces and monitored vaccination services for all four rounds.

title.narrative: Conducted detailed investigation of reported lab confirmed measles cases, other VPD cases and local immunization responses as per national guidelines

target.value: Technical support and conduct detailed investigation of reported VPD cases focusing on lab confirmed measles cases, plan and conduct local immunization responses

comment.narrative: WHO team fully supported/ensured to investigate of reported lab confirmed measles cases and other reported VPD cases despite COVID-19 pandemic. WHO also ensured and supported to conduct local immunization responses in reported case's village and surrounding villages

target.value: Technical support and conduct detailed investigation of reported VPD cases focusing on lab confirmed measles cases, plan and conduct local immunization responses

comment.narrative: WHO team fully supported/ensured to investigate of reported lab confirmed measles cases and other reported VPD cases despite COVID-19 pandemic. WHO also ensured and supported to conduct local immunization responses in reported case's village and surrounding villages

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
Half of all health centers with reported penta3 below 80% (numbers of health centers will be based on annual 2019 coverage report)

target.value: Technical support to Increase immunization coverage by improving quality of service delivery in health facilities with low Penta3 coverage in 5 north-east provinces.

comment.narrative: Technical support to PHD and OD EPI managers has been carried out through online meetings to keep track of immunization coverage on a quarterly basis, including analysis and identification of key bottlenecks, and discussion of possible solutions and corrective actions to be implemented in the next quarter.

title.narrative: Half of Health centers with high dropout of penta1-3 more than 10% reduced dropout rate to below 10% (numbers of health centers will be based on annual 2019 coverage report)

target.value: Technical support to implement default tracking mechanism and improving quality of service delivery in health facilities with high drop-out rates in 5 north-east provinces.

comment.narrative: The Penta1-3 dropout increased from 32% last year to 34% this year during the same period between Jan-May. The reason for increased drop out rate is mainly because of COVID-19 travel restrictions or fear of transmission leading to reduced uptake of services.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Completion training for remaining health facilities in IPC-I scaled up.

target.value: 4- Technical support to implement the communication strategy for immunization including scaling up the implementation of IPC-I packages.

comment.narrative: Due to ongoing increase of COVID-19 cases the Government continues to restrict trainings and workshops. However, NIP is planning with partner support to conduct virtual trainings in Q3 and catch up on this activity.

target.value: 4- Technical support to implement the communication strategy for immunization including scaling up the implementation of IPC-I packages.

comment.narrative: The National Communication Strategy for Immunization has been adopted and published for dissemination to all 25 provinces.

title.narrative: 60% of all the health facilities (N=800) with staff trained in Inter-personal communication for immunization (IPCI) and followed up.

target.value: Implement of communication strategy for immunization

comment.narrative: Due to ongoing increase of COVID-19 cases the Government continues to restrict trainings and workshops. However, NIP is planning with partner support to conduct virtual trainings in Q3 and catch up on this activity.

title.narrative: ? At least 60% of trained health staff are conducting IPC-I as per national plan and tools

target.value: 11- Techncial support to the Provincial and OD level to train immunization service providers at Health Center in IPC-I in five North-East provinces, including providing monitoring and supportive supervision support with OD

comment.narrative: The IPC-I training for Health Center staff had not been conducted due to government restriction to prevent the spread of COVID-19. The training is planned to be conducted in Q2-2022.

title.narrative: Launching the communication strategy and materials packages.

target.value: 4- Technical support to implement the communication strategy for immunization including scaling up the implementation of IPC-I packages.

comment.narrative: The National Communication Strategy for Immunization has been adopted and published for dissemination to all 25 provinces.

title.narrative: ? Two staff from all health centres (total 248 staff) in five North-East provinces will be trained on IPC-I.

target.value: 11- Techncial support to the Provincial and OD level to train immunization service providers at Health Center in IPC-I in five North-East provinces, including providing monitoring and supportive supervision support with OD

comment.narrative: Total 248 staff and HC level and 650 community health volunteers (VHSG/CCWC) trained in IPC-I. Following that, the trained HC staff continued to provide cascade training to VHSGs/CCWCs at community level. OD/PHD EPI Managers monitored health staff to perform their tasks related to IPC-I after training.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
Quatrely, annual progress of cold chain maintenance plan (Plan for Improvement 2020-2025) implemented.

target.value: 3- Technical support to implement the comprehensive cold chain maintenance plan (Plan for Improvement 2020-2025)

comment.narrative: A one year contract with private agency for preventive and repair maintenance for all WIC/WIF rooms has been established. The maintenance services is provided at quarterly basic. At sub national level, in province without trained technicians, the repair services are provided by the group of technicians from national program in every three months. At province with trained technicians, the transportation support are provided to enable to trained technician conduct field visit for checking and repairing to the OD and health center.

title.narrative: Comprehensive Operational Deployment Plan (ODP) to target health facilities where Cold Chain Equipment (CCE) will be developed and ready for deployment based on the annual approval for first year 185 and second year 592 refrigerators

target.value: 2- Technical support to NIP and suppliers for the deployment of CCEOP

comment.narrative: Developed the operational deployment plan(ODP) for CCEOP and CCE COVAX and submitted to UNICEF SD for recruitment of agency for in-country transportation, installation and training of Cold Chain Equipment.

title.narrative: Final wokplan and M&E framework for quarterly, annual progress tracking

target.value: 5- Technical support to scale up SOP implementation for immunization supply chain in health facilities for sub-national level : 1). Scale up using Gavi- HSS fund; 2). Assess the implementation of SOP in the provinces already trained.

comment.narrative: Due to the ongoing large-scale community transmission of COVID-19, the Government currently restricts training and therefore training in SOP for ISCL could not be done yet. Assessment of SOP application after training was conducted in the provinces already trained in SOP (prior to community outbreak) using the post training assessment tool for SOP. Through virtual training it is hoped this activity can be implemented in remaining half of 2021.

target.value: 5- Technical support to scale up SOP implementation for immunization supply chain in health facilities for sub-national level : 1). Scale up using Gavi- HSS fund; 2). Assess the implementation of SOP in the provinces already trained.

comment.narrative: The training on SOP for immunization supply chain is delayed due to government restriction to prevent the spread of COVID-19. However, the training is planned to carry out in 2022.

title.narrative: All staff and relevant stakeholders at Central Medical Store are trained in SOP for Vaccine Storage management.

target.value: 6- Technical support to NIP and Central Medical Store on vaccine storage management by training staff and relevant stakeholders in SOP.

comment.narrative: It has not been possible to conduct trainings, due to the high volume of incoming COVID-19 vaccine into the country and thus, CMS staff has been overwhelmed and very busy, and not able to conduct any training.

title.narrative: Defined key ISCL indicators (KPI) for ISCL monitoring each level agreed with defined method and time frame for data collection and analysis developed. Develop guideline and provide orientation on KPI.

target.value: 7- Technical support to NIP to establish and track key ISCL indicators: 1). Key indicators 2). Regular review/analyse, 3). Action follow up.

comment.narrative: Key ISCL indicators was past of the EVM assessment and a set of ISCL indicators was adopted and included in the EVM Improvement Plan for monitoring progress in the ISCL.

title.narrative: Final wokplan and M&E framework for quatrely, annual progress tracking

target.value: 6- Technical support to NIP and Central Medical Store on vaccine storage management by training staff and relevant stakeholders in SOP.

comment.narrative: Supported NIP and CMS to develop dashboard for tracking national vaccine stock levels displaying (this includes routine and COVID-19 vaccines): 1). CMS monthly stock report, 2). Procurement plan and actual delivery 3). Stock Reach (Estimated duration in months that stock will last), and 4). Consumption (CMS actual distribution and AMC)

title.narrative: Collecting and utilization the ISCL indicators

target.value: 7- Technical support to NIP to establish and track key ISCL indicators: 1). Key indicators 2). Regular review/analyse, 3). Action follow up.

comment.narrative: The Key Indicator for Immunization Supply Chain and logistic have been developed based on finding from EVM 2.0. The utilization of these KPI will be started in 2022.

title.narrative: The first year cold chain equipment deployed to the target health facilities along with other assessory commodities listed in the final document of the CCEOP application.

target.value: 2- Technical support to NIP and suppliers for the deployment of CCEOP

comment.narrative: The Operational Deployment Plan for year-1 is developed. The country already received and confirmed acceptance the Cost Estimation for Cold Chain Equipment for year 1.

title.narrative:
Web-based for ISCM used by NIP for national and sub-national level.
Monthly stock report and request of immunization supply chain from two sub-national levels available to take appropriate actions.

target.value: 1- Technical support to develop web-based immunisation supply chain management and promoting its use for management and operation: 1). Monthly stock report, 2). Request 3). Feedback loop improvement

comment.narrative: The Web-base for vaccine management is developed for CMS and PHD/OD. The Central Medical Store started to test entering the data when vaccine is arrived and when it is distributed to the province. The training to PHD/OD staff will be conducted in Quarter 4 of 2021.

title.narrative: Final wokplan and M&E framework for quarterly, annual progress tracking of cold chain maintenance plan (Plan for Improvement 2020-2025) developed and implemented.

target.value: 3- Technical support to implement the comprehensive cold chain maintenance plan (Plan for Improvement 2020-2025)

comment.narrative: The comprehensive cold chain maintenance plan has been implemented with last batch of trained staff completed their last course, Central level technician provides virtual coaching to the trained technicians during their repair work in the field. The cold chain maintenance plan will be implemented and monitored by Task Team for Immunization Supply Chain, which was included in the EVM Improvement Plan.

title.narrative: 60% of health facilities are trained in SOP

target.value: 5- Technical support to scale up SOP implementation for immunization supply chain in health facilities for sub-national level : 1). Scale up using Gavi- HSS fund; 2). Assess the implementation of SOP in the provinces already trained.

comment.narrative: The training on SOP for immunization supply chain is delayed due to government restriction to prevent the spread of COVID-19. However, the training is planned to carry out in 2022.

title.narrative:
Web-based for ISCM developped and endorse for early implementation.
Monthly stock report and request of immunization supply chain from two sub-national levels available to take appropriate actions.

target.value: 1- Technical support to develop web-based immunisation supply chain management and promoting its use for management and operation: 1). Monthly stock report, 2). Request 3). Feedback loop improvement

comment.narrative: Web-based for vaccine management has been is developed, tested and a first batch training was conducted before the current large-scale community outbreak of COVID-19. The training of other batches will be implemented in Q3.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
70% of newly assigned staff to take care of vaccines and supply chain will be trained in SOP.

target.value: 10- Technical and monitoring support for the implementation of SOPs for immunization supply chain in five north-eastern provinces

comment.narrative: 32 newly assigned staff for EPI (or about 14.5% of newly assigned staff) have not received training on SOP guideline due to restriction of trainings during the current large-scale COVID-19 outbreak. On another point, EPI managers are very busy to support COVID-19 vaccination and find it difficult to prioritize training.

target.value: 10- Technical and monitoring support for the implementation of SOPs for immunization supply chain in five north-eastern provinces

comment.narrative: The new staff responsible for vaccine and supply chain had not been trained face to face due to government restriction to prevent the spread of COVID-19. However, they received coaching through quarterly supervision. The training is planned to be conducted in Q2-2022.

title.narrative: ? Number of health centers in targeted provinces with reported penta3 coverage below 80% is reduced

target.value: 9. Technical support to PHD/OD/HC to increase immunization coverage by improving quality of service delivery in health facilities with low Penta3 coverage in five north-east provinces.

comment.narrative: 41 out of 110 health centers (37%) in targeted provinces with reported penta3 coverage below 80% (from Jan-Oct/2021). This number is increased compared to the same period last year (Jan-Oct/2020) with 54 of 110 health center (49%) reported penta 3 coverage below 80%. The reason is that number of village were locked down, delayed or unable to conduct catch up session and most parent fear of covid-19 transmission and so not to take children for vaccination.

title.narrative: Quarterly and annual data analysis report available for NIP to take appropriate actions.

target.value: 8- Technical support to development, implementation of AOP, Gavi-HSS and perform immunization data analysis with a focus on reaching the most vulnerable (e.g zero dose strategy)

comment.narrative: On-going support on monitoring the AOP implementation is provided to NIP. The result from quarterly field visit have been shared and discussed with NIP to inform and make timely corrected action.

title.narrative: Tools for default tracking mechanism developed and implemented.

target.value: 9. Technical support to PHD/OD/HC to increase immunization coverage by improving quality of service delivery in health facilities with low Penta3 coverage in five north-east provinces.

comment.narrative: 41 out of 110 health centers (37%) in targeted provinces with reported penta3 coverage below 80% (from Jan-Oct/2021). This number is increased compared to the same period last year (Jan-Oct/2020) with 54 of 110 health center (49%) reported penta 3 coverage below 80%. The reason is that number of village were locked down, delayed or unable to conduct catch up session and most parent fear of covid-19 transmission and so not to take children for vaccination.

target.value: 9. Technical support to PHD/OD/HC to increase immunization coverage by improving quality of service delivery in health facilities with low Penta3 coverage in five north-east provinces.

comment.narrative: The Penta1-3 dropout increased from 32% last year to 34% this year during the same period between Jan-May. The reason for increased drop out rate is mainly because of COVID-19 travel restrictions or fear of transmission leading to reduced uptake of services.

title.narrative: ? 100% of newly assigned staff to take care of vaccines and supply chain will be trained in SOP.

target.value: 10- Technical and monitoring support for the implementation of SOPs for immunization supply chain in five north-eastern provinces

comment.narrative: The new staff responsible for vaccine and supply chain had not been trained face to face due to government restriction to prevent the spread of COVID-19. However, they received coaching through quarterly supervision. The training is planned to be conducted in Q2-2022.

title.narrative: Workplan for the implementation of AOP 2021 developed with define roles for NIP and technical support from UNICEF (after AOP approval by MOH)

target.value: 8- Technical support to development, implementation of AOP, Gavi-HSS and perform immunization data analysis with a focus on reaching the most vulnerable (e.g zero dose strategy)

comment.narrative: UNICEF worked closely with NIP for monitoring the implementation of the activities listed in AOP with focus on service delivery, immunization supply chain and communication, C4D to minimize the disruption of routine immunization activities due to COVID-19 pandemic.

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
Data management guidelines/SOPs drafted

target.value: Technical support to develop guidelines/SOPs on data management capacity for sub-national as per recommendation from Gavi Audit

comment.narrative: This activity was not conducted because of inability to find good consultant. All levels of WHO and Gavi Secretariat have put efforts to find consultant but not found. WHO will continue to look for suitable consultant and try best to complete this activity by 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - General
Planned, prepared and implemented activities of NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS grants/other fund

target.value: Technical support to NIP/MOH in planning, preparing, implementing and monitoring of Gavi HSS grant's (including additional funds, other funds) supported activities as per NIP's AOP

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to prepare NIP AOP by using Gavi HSS 2 grant and other fund from other sources. However, because of COVID-19 pandemic situation there were restriction of movement or meeting/workshop/training though. Major activities like HRC and catch-up vaccination, training, etc were implemented.

target.value: Technical support to NIP/MOH in planning, preparing, implementing and monitoring of Gavi HSS grant's (including additional funds, other funds) supported activities as per NIP's AOP

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to prepare NIP AOP by using Gavi HSS 2 grant and other fund from other sources. However, because of COVID-19 pandemic situation there were restriction of movement or meeting/workshop/training though. Major activities like HRC and catch-up vaccination, training, etc were implemented.

title.narrative: Supported to plan and implement activities of NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS grants/ other fund

target.value: Technical support to NIP/MOH in planning, preparing, implementing and monitoring of Gavi HSS grant's (including additional funds, other funds) supported activities as per NIP's AOP

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to prepare NIP AOP by using Gavi HSS 2 grant and supported to plan, prepare, implement and monitor the activities. However, because of COVID-19 pandemic situation and restriction of movement or meeting/workshop/training, less activities were conducted in 2020 and early part of 2021.

target.value: Technical support to NIP/MOH in planning, preparing, implementing and monitoring of Gavi HSS grant's (including additional funds, other funds) supported activities as per NIP's AOP

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to prepare NIP AOP by using Gavi HSS 2 grant and supported to plan, prepare, implement and monitor the activities. However, because of COVID-19 pandemic situation and restriction of movement or meeting/workshop/training, less activities were conducted in 2020 and early part of 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Demand Promotion & ACSM
LED display in Phnom Penh, Radio airring in whole country and distribution of measles second dose poster in all schools in Cambodia to be continued

target.value: Strategic approaches to increase awareness and knowledge among public and generate demand for immunization programme

comment.narrative: Immunization communication campaign conducted from early 2021. Radio airing was made and LED was displayed. This found huge impact during COVID-19 pandemic to increase awareness and demand generation.

title.narrative: LED display in Phnom Penh, Radio airring in whole country to be continued

target.value: Strategic approaches to increase awareness and knowledge among public and generate demand for immunization programme

title.narrative: WHO : Data

40% of expected number of AFP and 50% of expected number of suspected measles cases to be reported from half of provinces. Immunization and surveillance data to be analysed/shared. Monthly VPD disease bulletin to be prepared and distributed.

target.value: Analysis of VPD surveillance performance indicators/reporting by national/ provinces/ODs/HCs, and conduct supervision and monitoring in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs

comment.narrative: Because of COVID-19 vaccination campaign involvement of NIP and hospital staff, AFP and suspected measles cases reported are less in first of 2021. Efforts made and ongoing to improve detection and reporting of suspected measles cases and AFP cases.

title.narrative: Exceed expected number of AFP cases and suspected measles cases reported from most of the provinces. Immunization and surveillance data to be analysed/shared and monthly VPD disease bulletin to be prepared and distributed.

target.value: Analysis of VPD surveillance performance indicators/reporting by national/ provinces/ODs/HCs, and conduct supervision and monitoring in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs

comment.narrative: WHO is supporting and working closely with NIP on VPD surveillance and performance indicators. AFP surveillance reporting dropped compared to in 2020. It is ongoing.

title.narrative: Reported lab confirmed measles, other VPD and AEFI cases to be conducted and ensured for detailed investigation and to conduct local immunization responses as per national guidelines

target.value: Conduct and plan of detailed investigation of reported VPD and AEFI cases with focused on lab confirmed measles cases and local immunization responses

comment.narrative: WHO team has been supporting and ensuring investigation of lab confirmed measles cases and other VPD cases. Also supported on investigation, risk communication, risk assessment and management of reported serious AEFI cases.

target.value: Conduct and plan of detailed investigation of reported VPD and AEFI cases with focused on lab confirmed measles cases and local immunization responses

title.narrative: WHO : Human Resources for Health
Analysis gaps, discussion to be held with NIP and plan to be made to conduct one national training worshop with provincial and OD staff and six low-performing OD level training with HC level staff

target.value: Conduct capacity building activities for sub-national staff on routine immunization and VPD surveillance

comment.narrative: Analysis conducted and discussion held in NIP and plan not made yet because of restriction of meeting/workshop.

title.narrative: One national level training to be conducted

target.value: Conduct capacity building activities for sub-national staff on routine immunization and VPD surveillance

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
Discussions to be held with central NIP and to prepare agenda and presentation for dissucsion provincial NIP staff in regular quaterly meeting

target.value: Technical assistance to NIP to implement zero dose strategy/reach the unreached (service delivery assessment, catch-up, defaulter tracking, VSHG/community engagement, antenatal care/post natal care services, screening of under five under IMC, registration, involvement of commune council, data monitoring)

comment.narrative: Discussion held but this activity did not take place yet because of COVID-19 related restriction on meeting/workshop/training

title.narrative: Discussions to be held with central NIP and to share the action points to PHDs and ODs for implementation

target.value: Technical support to NIP to initiate implementation of the action plans for immunization and VPD surveillance in international border provinces

comment.narrative: Discussions was held with central NIP and to share the action points to PHDs and ODs for implementation but did not able to conduct any meeting with sub-national staff

title.narrative: Meeting to be held with provincial NIP staff for information, awareness and brain storming on implementation of zero dose strategies/reaching the unreached within the scope of routine immunization activities, and recommended actions to be provided.

target.value: Technical assistance to NIP to implement zero dose strategy/reach the unreached (service delivery assessment, catch-up, defaulter tracking, VSHG/community engagement, antenatal care/post natal care services, screening of under five under IMC, registration, involvement of commune council, data monitoring)

comment.narrative: WHO has been supporting the country to implement reaching to the unreached strategy.

title.narrative: Support to analyze, plan and prepare high-risk communities/catch-up vaccination outreach services and participate in monitoring of one round of high-risk community and catch-up vaccination outreach services and to monitor routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs and four urban provinces.

target.value: Support to plan, prepare, implement and monitor high-risk community and catch-up vaccination outreach services and conduct monitoring of routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs and four urban provinces

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to analyze the coverage and other situation and assisted to plan and prepare four rounds of high-risk communities/catch-up vaccination outreach services. Due to COVID-19 vaccination campaign, this year planned bit late like in May and first round already implemented in June. WHO staff and consultants participated in monitoring of first round of high-risk community and catch-up vaccination outreach services and to monitor routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs.

title.narrative: Plan, prepare and implement activities of NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS grants/other fund

target.value: Technical support to NIP for planing, preparation and implementation of Gavi HSS grant's supported activities as per approved NIP's AOP and; support to other Gavi related activities

comment.narrative: WHO team supported to prepare NIP AOP 2021 by using Gavi HSS 2 grant and other fund from other sources. However, because of COVID-19 pandemic situation there are restriction of movement or meeting/workshop/training though more focused was made in COVID-19 vaccination campaign in first half of 2021. Major activities like HRC and catch-up vaccination, training, EVM related activities, etc. started implementing/will be implemented.

title.narrative: Support to analyze, plan and prepare high-risk communities/catch-up vaccination outreach services and participate in monitoring of one/two rounds of high-risk community and catch-up vaccination outreach services and to monitor routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs and four urban provinces.

target.value: Support to plan, prepare, implement and monitor high-risk community and catch-up vaccination outreach services and conduct monitoring of routine immunization activities in low performing provinces/ODs/HCs and four urban provinces

title.narrative: Plan, prepar and implement activities of NIP's AOP by using Gavi HSS grants/other fund

target.value: Technical support to NIP for planing, preparation and implementation of Gavi HSS grant's supported activities as per approved NIP's AOP and; support to other Gavi related activities

title.narrative: Monitor implementation of action points by reviewing/visiting at least three international border provinces

target.value: Technical support to NIP to initiate implementation of the action plans for immunization and VPD surveillance in international border provinces
